Lines.c0fba499-2192-bf4d-590b-d3263f8a7197: I am relieved to see Karlach enjoying her new form. She deserves all the wonders illithidness offers.
Lines.e76a4ff9-e9ad-98ff-a6ec-6e772ca31f33: It is good to see Shadowheart enjoying her freedom. I hope Selûne treats her better than Shar did.
Lines.e06c5e33-4570-9d3f-bbf0-343ecbc860e7: I am pleased to see that Gale has settled into a comfortable life. The dissemination of knowledge suits him.
Lines.deadf9ff-235a-c913-19c3-8d5eb734a7bf: It is good to see Shadowheart enjoying her freedom. She deserves a peaceful life after everything she went through.
Lines.dda8b590-787d-5346-ea25-6a5a503e25ad: It is a pity to see Astarion still cowering in Cazador's shadow. I know what it is like to be haunted like that.
Lines.d2c24cf1-f7e0-90c5-4519-07b534917f0c: Gale is making good use of his freedom... and he has adopted a healthy balance of ambition and realism.
Lines.d12c888d-0ea8-5fa5-846a-7184bab595e6: While Gale's ambition is admirable, his reward has only inflated his arrogance. He seems to have learned little from his mistakes.
Lines.270c1d8a-b7c4-4379-ef8b-6f37b738a5ac: So... Scratch found the Astral Prism. How resourceful...
Lines.30b21054-cac1-94ae-0ee1-d2fa9acb7d75: You should let him keep it. We have no use for it, and he deserves a token to remember you by.
Lines.65adf66f-c2db-0889-2470-25931e6e1095: Wyll's sense of duty to the commoner seems as strong as ever. I hope he is more judicious with his target selections now, though...
Lines.749625ed-fad9-9cf4-f873-7dbe372283bf: So... Lae'zel accomplished her dream - to fuel the githyanki queen. A purpose shared by many illithids living under elder brains.
Lines.6f44ac68-ce42-f53b-ea12-bcdd7829545a: Though unlike them, this was her choice. I'm happy for her.
Lines.78545301-aad5-8d1e-343f-5687e2a97b0a: It was kind of Wyll to travel to Avernus with Karlach. Caring for those close to you is a respectable trait.
Lines.38e78d89-be9e-5177-0d30-901ef78a88e5: Shadowheart's devotion to her people is commendable... but deities are selfish beings undeserving of such blind worship.
Lines.e882f4f5-c479-bba1-4a6a-603bccb395c3: My love. Are you enjoying the party?
Lines.753f2884-a8d5-63e7-2bd9-c9f2648c147f: Karlach did not deserve a return to Avernus... but I'm glad she is not alone. And the news that her heart might not be beyond repair is a relief.
Lines.08019906-a645-eb32-d545-a3a6964bd854: Lae'zel has seized her future - no longer is she any monarch's pawn.
Lines.9d3a2d5f-9e64-feda-fe63-c3dc6630f26e: I suppose you're right... let's do it.
Lines.9eb0a5b7-140b-028f-bf9d-990eb7f76d41: I believe the colony is mature enough to not require our constant supervision... but if it would make you feel better to stay, than you should.
Lines.a04f114d-a65d-99c6-e7c3-86dc3082d917: Very well. I look forward to your selection.
Lines.a48513a3-fa4e-7080-eb75-b4955759989d: Baldur's Gate is already struggling to sustain us. We must find other sources of food if we wish to expand.
Lines.7c377f72-5312-a526-563c-c6cebda5f926: Rascal was a wonderful companion. We could use the light dogs offer.
Lines.a6d53b47-42c0-477f-7b07-add379bb6fc3: We need to find a way to acquire those items...
Lines.c4f42f62-cb58-a171-8aef-1f5ed4219688: Thank you, love. That means a lot to me.
Lines.a8f342b9-8919-9a40-4c67-fc455ddc5338: You know, the last time I was at such a gathering undisguised, in garb that reflected my form...
Lines.d31c1a3f-16ff-94a5-5c79-f0c34ae83666: It was before my transformation. Things have changed so much since then. I... don't know how to process these feelings.
Lines.aab9d94d-3782-d9fd-73aa-cccd1b8076b2: Now that that's settled... shall we return to the party?
Lines.ae656445-ec83-a653-1c76-80fab72d9fc1: Indeed. Yet when presented with evidence to the contrary, she chose to ignore it. Enthralled illithids are never given such an opportunity.
Lines.ae916614-5c06-78fa-338a-63ec1ade8190: To be clear, his death would not help us. We need his aberrant expertise to continue intellect devourer production.
Lines.af23697d-ea52-ebc7-44a0-b873e81f9350: We should maintain our relationship with Wyll - having leverage with someone of his power could greatly help us.
Lines.b51d30ad-75e0-63cb-1ba1-eacd7aaf6572: It is good to see that Halsin's community is doing well - just as ours is.
Lines.b6f35aff-f738-f532-b077-18c2abd91213: I'm glad you have not committed to helping Lae'zel raid that githyanki outpost. Our organization cannot get involved in interstellar politics.
Lines.b796bfdf-71ab-59ad-cd0e-c2f012fa27b9: Minthara will likely have a role in our extension to Menzoberranzan. It will be up to her if she would like to be our ally... or our adversary.
Lines.cc673f9f-18e4-0c12-1e21-2de141e13002: I was wondering... would you be interested in getting a dog?
Lines.05f7076d-e3e3-730a-5284-ef2fa706fb41: There is no need to apologize, love. I understand.
Lines.9538449a-e0b0-d5eb-7609-6dbab209dec4: We should return to the party... until everyone has settled.
Lines.794690fd-e70e-3016-935c-4c385bd8106b: I hoped it would not come to that. I wish to explore other options first... like finding groups of criminals ourselves.
Lines.79e07ebc-ccda-6436-2d3f-1746322c935a: Thank you, my love... I'm glad my musings don't bore you.
Lines.7c27b275-a1a8-c47b-cf23-73722e28feff: I won't be. It is important to me.
Lines.7e532b86-26cf-881c-60d6-435222c400e8: Minsc continues to get himself into trouble. I'm glad our alliance with him proved more fruitful then getting us captured.
Lines.7faae801-e503-f319-1228-b436d60631b3: We eat criminals like them. There is no reason to treat this group any differently.
Lines.dbb21a80-bc7f-d631-b6c8-1be77a8038c3: I have read much of its alien colors, infinite layers, writhing tendrils, labyrinthian dimensions...
Lines.815d52c3-1c66-e270-012a-81b7bbdfd6e9: The monstruous beauty of that plane would be a sight to behold. One I would love to share with you.
Lines.81b973fa-d649-9ee4-4503-61e0de793cf2: Grey Harbor services vessels traveling all of Toril. We will find one to take.
Lines.825fd8b1-d109-6361-b75e-51e865916720: Our reach extends across the Coast. Xanathar's does not.
Lines.b95792b5-4f3c-c273-90ec-c3e5335328f5: I expect its ambitions to overpower its allegiances of their own accord. Though it they do not, I will force them to.
Lines.838a83da-112d-1088-9b0e-b85c5653f884: It is a chance to maintain our alliances. We do not need to enjoy it, but it is necessary.
Lines.83935e8c-8d4a-cfcb-db0f-f9a2996ded6c: Of course, love. We can discuss this later.
Lines.892a52b9-e2b4-6872-d263-8a272387b0d3: You decided to join the Harpers? We will be far from here soon. I'm not sure how you plan to be of service to them.
Lines.8abdf2b2-797f-fffd-2021-dbb3dae8127e: And I never thought I would have the honor of love again.
Lines.8b2d79a3-72c7-efe2-ed69-0d4f5da88e73: *A series of images flash through your mind - each wrapped in pure affection.*
Lines.8c772901-b3d2-077e-839e-89aa2c1fa519: Jaheira is capable... she could be a threat to our plans. We should be ready to deal with her should the time come.
Lines.92db94f9-e454-4d7f-073b-e9c8e3c66b6f: That could prove beneficial. Moonrise should have records on how to handle them properly; we should search for those when we return.
Lines.9431dbad-4323-3146-cc06-624cd9650391: Halsin's community building reminds me of my own, all those years ago...
Lines.9841e991-0186-e141-5e1a-6e4777e35c03: This is a significant waste... but I will do as you wish, love. I will extract all knowledge of the temple's location and their time in it.
Lines.b9b62017-a96a-7a9f-4054-d146ba793481: So, Minsc is the one guarding the illithid technology... we will need to find a way past him if Keene does not agree to let us have it.
Lines.ba7ca116-3f8b-471c-3cf8-99f6793138d7: We could spend eternity there and we would still not see everything the Outer Planes have to offer. I would be honored to travel there with you.
Lines.bacaf1f8-a7b6-5594-7d59-9848bfb0e373: In her final moments, she knew only glory.
Lines.d69a3539-bc57-6dc0-5160-31fc12216707: I no longer feel comfortable at social events. Besides, our allies do not think highly of me.
Lines.ee723c30-b6d1-4c3d-99dd-4300f978d675: I am glad you are enjoying it though. Sincerely. You deserve a break.
Lines.dd57bc62-1bfd-33d2-35dd-024fcdd88be1: Minthara would have been a significant adversary had we chosen to run the Knights. I admire her skill.
Lines.fe3c8e5e-1394-dc79-958f-ba283eba1452: Astarion's pathetic attempts at lording will be his end. He cannot survive the Baldur's Gate underworld without recognizing his own faults.
Lines.df06a4f3-67c7-ec89-c86c-1c5b1324868a: I hope it will not come to that. He is illithid, and thus controlling his mind would be a significant and draining challenge.
Lines.fadf2d15-a2d3-6836-4e19-c107615c0385: The home of the githyanki. Exploring their lands will be enlightening. Let's do it.
Lines.e0e366cf-1041-21c1-5892-f09c858b0e49: We seem to have reached an impasse. We can discuss this later.
Lines.e13263a5-34dc-d98d-e88d-21683dc12142: I'm glad you decided to help Lae'zel. Fighting githyanki is always thrilling.
Lines.e13861c9-3021-af73-d1ee-9d98f03e1bfa: I disagree. We are capable, and illithid technology will only make us stronger.
Lines.e321278f-e3c7-79a2-ac02-a651e2903358: Our contacts in Waterdeep have informed me of a free illithid living below the city that calls himself Nihiloor.
Lines.e3eb323a-e714-d349-8723-5775830e43c4: I'm glad you decided to help Astarion. It should be an enjoyable excursion for us.
Lines.e5cbda23-cbc6-5e0c-7679-391b44614fb1: His demeaning comments on your form are despicable. Of all those who are not illithid, he should understand our position.
Lines.e7307401-25b6-1671-e67c-5cde6940bd5f: It is good to hear that Astarion's community is doing as well as ours. Perhaps we could collaborate on a food source...
Lines.faddaf1a-7f40-53d8-5087-1381bf53be4b: The Guild is still hoarding illithid technology leftover from the battle. As illithids, we could put those items to far better use than them... and it would give us a significant advantage.
Lines.f88aa30c-c588-9c6d-e18a-907d0c596de8: I... hadn't considered that. Now that you mention it, it seems obvious... they were to be executed anyway and would be grateful for a second chance.
Lines.ec2029d5-0c9d-bed0-4fdc-d4a4945f2672: Jaheira continues to fight... her resilience is impressive.
Lines.f19d1872-6a5b-d76e-3c8f-564ccecc0654: We should discuss this with the Guild when we return home. I would prefer a peaceful means of obtaining this technology...
Lines.f2a85a8d-53ea-cf95-2093-e0ce21b644c3: You're right. But I wouldn't mourn conflict's arrival.
Lines.f3b353e7-bd41-0433-e9a1-4b04f3baf6a3: It is a risk, I agree. Though if they don't prove useful, we can eat them later... even if enthrallment diminishes their psychic energies.
Lines.d4126419-dfe2-6742-8f4b-515ff6fef8ae: I look forward to our journey - and the time we will have together alone.
Lines.f604aa23-910f-c5db-1ee3-fa4b99eef8aa: I hadn't planned on subjecting anyone to ceremorphosis... but you're right. We can offer them so much - a new home, and a new life.
Lines.d2807385-0884-b36b-3492-ef5a4216fbe9: Before we worked with him, I would not have been against such an idea. Now though... I fear I cannot accurately predict his reaction to such interference.
Lines.baee84e1-7bb7-3ad6-f721-83d9c4730679: That's good to hear. It's... unsettling to be around these people physically instead of mentally.
Lines.bb49c548-e0f8-b90f-7542-efcc802ec7c1: My love... it is an honor to share my life with you.
Lines.bbc289f0-f32f-760e-31de-c98afe73f85c: I think it would be more reliable to work directly with the Guild - either through mental or social means.
Lines.bc55ef92-150b-3fed-ac94-a5d1394e4bd8: I feel the same way. These people... remind me of my old crew.
Lines.be1f1d62-2f39-f203-fbc4-3477bb146a93: Yes. If he can convince the people to see reason, we might even be able to move into the upper levels of the tower someday.
Lines.bf527b97-3a71-e3e0-4c45-018f03411c27: You decided to join the Harpers? An interesting strategy... I suppose it will be good to have a foothold in such a powerful organization.
Lines.77f9cd0c-49ee-82af-fd57-b077ef00801e: We should discuss this with the Zhentarim when we return home. I would prefer a peaceful means of obtaining this technology...
Lines.e1e92930-e751-34dc-c1aa-4b41f6d35745: No. I am not one for mingling. Besides, our allies do not hold high opinions of me.
Lines.c13b934d-e4b6-67fe-da84-a87383e843d9: I think it is in everyone's best interests if you do the talking, love.
Lines.c1bda9f4-4472-7f42-6d5a-1a88d0a9f272: The Zhentarim is still hoarding illithid technology leftover from the battle. As illithids, we could put those items to far better use than them... and it would give us a significant advantage.
Lines.c2f9ed9f-04e8-55a1-8960-03f11d6e1103: *Restoring the headquarters of the Knights to the center of an operation with fingers throughout the city.*
Lines.c648b959-db7f-0d61-b263-bcdec40fd67e: Our organizations cannot afford to get tied up in githyanki politics, so unfortunately we will need to take on the outpost Lae'zel found alone.
Lines.c64ef410-7c3c-9ae0-08da-a42e3db23ce7: Very well. Know that this is a significant setback.
Lines.5305f6a1-f108-10a4-be87-709c2688c857: I believe so. Caring for them is far simpler than running an organization like ours.
Lines.c6b9a0cc-3656-e87c-b49c-377a0e7992be: I did want to discuss something else with you.
Lines.ca92dfdc-83fc-bb33-2040-06f050bb7642: I'm glad you agree. I hope they will as well.
Lines.d05c696e-ecb6-cf43-5c44-f8f06de09a5d: That githyanki outpost Lae'zel mentioned would be a good source of food for the colony. You should consider helping her attack it.
Lines.73370f52-1535-0684-4e31-b9bd5a7f0b14: We should extend an invitation to it to visit us; I'm sure it would find our home's wealth of illithid history and knowledge valuable.
Lines.c28012fd-fe35-076a-d73a-1e99cf646c61: However, we need a more short-term solution.
Lines.5c2e3b18-a4ae-8c72-c031-f9b13aca1077: Your leadership against the Netherbrain more than qualifies you for your role. An elder should have more to their name than age.
Lines.ffbd131d-9f93-e31d-db79-df2205323b11: Helping Astarion is a risk. I fear I cannot come with you - Moonrise can hardly afford to lose one elder, let alone two.
Lines.005a9c9b-7a9a-4b3f-4d30-6b7271697080: I hope you're right. Perhaps the taboo of the Absolute will prevent them from moving into the tower.
Lines.72926639-f885-d62a-77f3-c28264b2879f: Astarion's grating arrogance is his weakness. Should he ever step in our way... it will be simple to outmaneuver him.
Lines.73bbb0d6-44c0-daf8-8a5b-065632f0a866: The tressym does not keep her opinions to herself. A strategy that will not gain her many allies.
Lines.166f056e-bff6-47cc-7b3e-3cf9b44f9de0: Helping Astarion is a strategic move. We have the resources to spare, and in return we would gain his allyship.
Lines.16b35236-6768-5301-1137-ca4dd7ba022b: Jaheira's retirement is advantageous for us. She could have been a threat to our plans.
Lines.16c4b895-60f7-e9cb-bd03-9b62f8b234f0: Very well. This continent can surprise anyone, even someone as well-traveled as me.
Lines.171b760a-6327-6951-cb94-6160696c1a79: Wyll is idealistic... I hope that does not hinder him from exercising his authority as he should.
Lines.195b8324-526a-e25e-167c-7e8972a92a7f: It seems Astarion is taking full advantage of his freedom.
Lines.199b8b1d-010b-abda-0979-1519c1c887c6: That won't be necessary. Nihiloor is known to be practical.
Lines.a412657c-9448-095c-e8a1-31742f3029a7: She was a high-ranking Fist who evolved during the attack.
Lines.b20b5237-06e0-ecf1-297d-202b923d4392: If she was not a trained fighter, she likely would have been slaughtered along with most of the other newly transformed.
Lines.1a54d20d-f70c-46e8-e16e-02ed2c04bb33: Araelya is skilled and fearless. We could use someone like her, especially now when the rebirth of the Knights needs stability.
Lines.1c4e3a2c-f576-f5b3-5bcd-f9eda6dd8929: Very well. Your optimism always fascinates me.
Lines.78ea0d79-81cd-408b-e0db-42be667be416: We should use this time on Faerûn to prepare for our raid of Zariel's forge.
Lines.1e355a6d-3d94-0f8e-1528-673575adc416: I need to eat something other than cambion brains. They provide very little nourishment.
Lines.1e6243d4-6a98-0daa-c644-9c2d232ba3a9: I hadn't planned on subjecting anyone to ceremorphosis... but you're right. I will see it done.
Lines.63758e17-d8ad-7d6c-ceb3-8485fa7a8e05: And don't worry about our concealing our identities... there are more long lasting ways of protecting those than our usual disguises.
Lines.1f3ff9c9-5567-acc5-c37c-9e435499c9e8: You should pick our subsequent destination. Where would you like to go?
Lines.1f4797f9-4d98-9e0b-3ee1-4b261f78b8c9: It seems Astarion is taking full advantage of his freedom - just as we are.
Lines.2202679c-5f55-3a40-b7a2-7755b4150d22: I agree. A prize like that is worth such measures.
Lines.24aa2121-5efb-b8a1-8c00-fbcb61f8118b: Yes... I was interested in them before I transformed. Completing a journey around all of Toril would be highly rewarding.
Lines.2829abe5-cb0e-2086-2f49-3f9c0f31c3c3: Very well... we will bide our time for now. None will know how to use that technology - it is likely that it will still be available to us in the future.
Lines.f6899fcb-bffd-c6de-9eb3-df58345f59ad: Our next shipment of food from Baldur's Gate should arrive at Moonrise shortly after our return.
Lines.28624fb3-070b-c051-7a33-5ae02e88542f: Our colony's numbers are too small to waste efforts on menial tasks. It would benefit us to enthrall these criminals rather than consume them.
Lines.2c8d7c4e-238e-82dd-3fc6-6a18234728f5: Volo's tall tales will distract the public from our real plans. It is best to humor him.
Lines.2ebf8c92-f6bd-974c-aa02-b5ca8b8106fd: Volo's embellishments are... excessive. Before my transformation, I might have approved of them... now, I'm not so sure.
Lines.da745b8c-9c14-f3d8-de50-fb073721bdc7: Our progress in restoring the Knights of the Shield is progressing well. I believe we are ready for the next step.
Lines.2f7190ef-ade3-81e6-9e5b-54470110a292: Vengeance Knights were special enforcers that served under elite members of our organization. It would benefit us to restore them.
Lines.62e12a91-1c5c-d163-1eba-4bcb9fe18cfa: *Discussing reports, planning moves, meeting with officials.*
Lines.301b6933-ca6c-5c56-4bb8-ff1a5f60bdd4: *Relaxing in bed with the Emperor, as the outside world fades away.*
Lines.309ba3e4-7888-a488-f95f-fe53f9a48908: Yes. We should find an isolated corner once everyone has gone to sleep... I have waited so long to explore your mind and body again.
Lines.30e37667-03c9-7f98-ef2a-a10fe6eab113: Arrogance is a risk. But... you're right. They are no match for a colony of illithids, even a small one like ours.
Lines.1fcb8ee5-760d-81a3-6fe6-74dc4c447a1b: Though I hope our time in one place will be limited. Variety is adventure's blessing... and we must never forget where our home is: Baldur's Gate.
Lines.85c40c3b-e5f5-6583-3155-fa36f7819f05: Upon our return, I will direct the rest of the Concord of Elders to focus on finding us a second source of food with this in mind.
Lines.31570059-aaf6-95ca-ef37-643f1ade496a: While we have received newcomers, we are ready for more. We are ready to liberate.
Lines.5b944c81-abf8-77d1-4dfd-3dabaf06978f: The Underdark region of Old Shanatar is close, and its proclivity for illithids renders it a suitable starting point.
Lines.4823c9f4-fa49-0061-20c4-8e39b3a9f69e: I suggest we leave Moonrise in the care of the rest of the Concord and travel there in search of illithids that desire freedom.
Lines.cb846bb5-7f26-c436-55c3-9d6107c3e822: Ordinarily, I would be tempted to negotiate. Now though... illithid technology is too valuable to lose.
Lines.14b776f6-1e26-326f-3866-9884a1449d68: We can begin with dealmaking... but we will use force if they do not see reason.
Lines.132beca2-be7d-0ce7-a94a-f644329d00a6: We must also decide what to do with the Bhaalists we captured...
Lines.2b659f37-88f9-2b84-acec-4c98585febd5: Their misfortune in finding that their temple has become a mind flayer colony will be our opportunity.
Lines.0089c497-7254-15d1-d6ef-05374f3d80a5: I didn't mean to sour the party. Let us turn to brighter matters.
Lines.017543a4-86da-ca50-b3fa-6ae37e6c2cfd: Neither have I. I was not anticipating seeing them again... at least not so soon.
Lines.02fe3a6f-26a3-5259-d2c1-c9a97941c8e1: Kuuexiz lived in Moonrise. They piloted a nautiloid which the githyanki destroyed just prior to the brain's death.
Lines.d92cf7f4-4013-65ca-89eb-977586e948e1: Once gaining their freedom, they found sanctuary in the sewers. They led a group of survivors until we found them.
Lines.d9eb75c5-49a9-d04b-c5f1-9a305b2e266f: Magic use was limited in Moonrise - Kuuexiz is a sorcerer. Now that they are free, the full might of their magic is free as well.
Lines.03a07156-8005-e661-61f5-7ef23e42027e: Restoring my psionics will give us a major advantage. I have not been fully equipped for a long time.
Lines.0a3e4dbf-5bd3-afea-b366-798753b44e69: Building a network across the Sword Coast has a cost. This is part of it.
Lines.048555f2-850f-972a-f795-5e9176ea4299: I can handle this if you are averse to it.
Lines.0488c080-3f66-c307-c21a-7439ecfd32f4: *Finding illithid survivors hiding in the sewers. They feared they would not live through the day.*
Lines.ec41f582-b601-0111-3abd-04da6cc4faea: *Creating a colony for them - a Baldurian colony - in Bhaal's temple, while simultaneously rebuilding the Knights.*
Lines.06e918ff-d0e9-8a25-80f0-a348e1de0314: You decided to join the Harpers? I hope your obligations to them do not interfere with your other work...
Lines.08441f8d-e98a-cde3-9651-4d4b16287bc9: When we return home, I would like to discuss our list of agents with you. The ideal candidates should be martially sound and devoted to our cause.
Lines.08cb89b4-0f69-2148-b344-ecde386638d7: I wish we could have stayed away as well. But your conclusion on the integrity of our circle is sound.
Lines.093e5b17-d8a8-53b3-e954-717a2bf34264: I never thought I would willingly return to colony life... but the freedom and your presence make it wonderful.
Lines.098bc809-4cef-19d3-e42b-a52205d62572: They are refreshingly open-minded. We are lucky to have attracted such fascinating - and useful - illithids.
Lines.09acee0b-42b1-f474-b720-f126cfd970e3: Halsin's community remains a problem for us. I fear their expansion into Moonrise will reveal our subterranean colony.
Lines.97e009c0-ff97-deee-90c9-607f6684d6f9: They expect the Absolute's forces to be eradicated... if they find that not only have they survived but are rebuilding their lives, they will respond violently.
Lines.0c63ce1c-a5ad-ce59-5344-fca26f5e4292: I fear that newly transformed illithids would have a propensity for mistakes that would reveal our location. We cannot afford that.
Lines.0d366368-2ba2-3e8b-56dd-e843407d3bbe: We will not be tyrants. We have not explored all alternatives. We will search for criminals we can capture ourselves.
Lines.0d53d63e-dad5-e52d-515b-a3f1cde960da: Perhaps... but our donations to the reconstruction did earn us favor with the High Constable and Master of Walls.
Lines.a5763ff8-b848-7d29-0b4a-2a8b3ab55527: There is always more information to trade with in the city's underworld.
Lines.0df400d4-6ce6-247c-ca0e-ed12329fc0ba: I hoped it would not come to that... but it is the most reliable option.
Lines.0e09ca28-e2fd-1544-bf6a-765017cd31f6: Minthara... another player in Baldur's Gate. We should take her authority seriously. She could challenge our rule if we are not careful.
Lines.0e95116e-1252-aa67-9ae3-9a7b6f1c805c: *You and the Emperor finding illithid survivors of the Netherbrain battle and guiding them back to Moonrise.*
Lines.e3212ec7-07fa-a2b4-9122-0bee4d961c4c: *Spreading rumors of an illithid colony with a different vision.*
Lines.ea1d0e4d-9852-f4bc-a8c8-14bfbf903610: *Forming the Concord of Elders, distributing food, learning the stories of your people.*
Lines.5310a2ec-a48f-d322-9481-7a252037cef8: *Sitting with the Emperor in your chambers, away from the noise - reading a book, then falling asleep together.*
Lines.0fec3f0f-143c-7a59-5e44-895c41edc4df: With a consistent supply of intellect devourers, we could make the entire Parliament of Peers our puppet.
Lines.a8881586-9ec7-4313-0ea5-6bf9d0426c68: After we seize control here, we can move on to the governments of the other Coast cities.
Lines.107b52c9-ac19-c02a-9066-a35ede5b1bc6: Minthara is a skilled tactician. Her clash with Menzoberranzan will be informative, regardless of if it ends in her victory or not.
Lines.11dd67e8-d523-369e-5dc6-72e3e906880f: Minsc's antics have jeopardized our alliance with the Zhentarim... we must ensure that they do not learn that he was freed on our behalf.
Lines.12cc61e1-a8a9-0cac-03d6-0aceb40e4c80: I'm glad you agree. I look forward to that discussion.
Lines.1322063a-6a48-db20-a627-f9b1a2982840: I felt that needed to be said, even if we both know it to be true.
Lines.aefab27c-d076-af7f-4e32-b07abd402797: Anyway... there was something else I wanted to discuss.
Lines.0c4965ee-6a55-44ec-0c88-0b3e69e8233d: And I am glad I will not have to be away from you.
Lines.74598d8d-7ebf-3f6c-b204-f91dfb0684c8: I will never tire of your enthusiasim, love. I am thankful as well for this respite from the Hells.
Lines.322f3940-3aff-d1d3-945a-36dd3793ee92: I appreciate the sentiment, but I prefer brains raw... and the thrill of sucking them directly out of their vessel.
Lines.3306818e-a19b-4888-742b-a9e068d051b2: Unfortunately, no. But I'm sure we will settle on someone eventually. Several of our agents are more capable warriors then strategists.
Lines.78adf7c7-5d30-42d6-b629-c35dd05951fe: He specializes in the creation and deployment of intellect devourers in the service of Xanathar's Thieves Guild.
Lines.5c5a7615-b952-7f52-8e54-f68fc51006f6: A foothold in that organization would be invaluable... we would control Waterdhavian trade, and by extension a large swath of territory north of the city.
Lines.8845f287-0473-43a0-5e81-589b2558b916: We must make an ally of him.
Lines.5e296810-6a96-7873-af5a-fc998c588f40: It is good to hear that Astarion's community is doing well. I did not expect Astarion to be a capable leader, but he proved me wrong.
Lines.60f46df4-3672-aa1f-ce74-c3d3a857528d: She wanted nothing more than to serve her queen. What better way to do so than with her very essence?
Lines.612df0fb-0151-a6db-ed49-f04d1be69e60: You can certainly try... though I believe he is too unpredictable to anticipate how he will react. We don't know where his loyalties lie.
Lines.64266250-197d-098d-efba-46b33cfb14e6: However, it would be worth trading our alliance for them.
Lines.65109ef4-42dc-f1b0-bd9c-c041bc4ba3f9: It was beautiful. Wondrous creatures, sprawling underground cities, dazzling vistas...
Lines.a64a20bd-2b7e-1075-d60d-2f3f21b82115: That is a fine pick. Let's do it.
Lines.65af4492-6e56-fe13-693a-b8fe5085d25d: A fine choice. The variety this system offers is astonishing.
Lines.685510bd-bf5a-9927-0653-8277bdc0003b: We should consider helping Lae'zel attack that githyanki outpost. It would be a thrilling adventure.
Lines.68c3b109-721e-ae8b-747c-1644f4450d5e: We should discuss this with Nine-Fingers when we return home. I would prefer a peaceful means of obtaining this technology...
Lines.68e0f18a-804b-bf87-667a-7faa83baf04e: Very well. I will assign Kuuexiz to Sorcerous Sundries and Alaerya to the Fist.
Lines.6c544d1e-b36b-47b1-eb7d-fe8c61d19a19: Those positions suit their strengths, and we could use a foothold in those factions.
Lines.6a0c5f96-d410-d9d5-555f-d974fd44114f: Intellect devourer puppets could rectify our Calimshan problem - they will be our eyes in a blind spot.
Lines.6de28530-dbff-699c-54fa-871179211deb: Minsc continues to fascinate me. I wonder what he would be like as an illithid...
Lines.6dee8d81-acaa-9ff5-660c-54ff89bfb207: Very well. Sustenance is always valuable to us.
Lines.6e195b56-badd-c9ea-4dbf-51cad179ff8e: I would be willing to trade our positions in the Watch Citadel we gained in the reconstruction with them for that technology.
Lines.6e6d13aa-b120-ccf7-0161-3bbedd7edc7b: I'm glad you decided to help Lae'zel. We should bring some illithids from the colony to help us preserve brains.
Lines.707f223f-786e-b0a9-45be-709442aad541: I understand. I still have not developed immunity to such comments, and I have been a mind flayer for centuries.
Lines.72fce169-181c-f490-5391-81e65ebf36a2: *The Emperor beams another dose of affection into your mind. It nearly overpowers your senses.*
Lines.73b45c5c-132f-a007-1f11-07b76b46be2e: As unpredictable as Minsc is, he has captured the Zhentarim's attention. That could be beneficial for our alliance with the Guild.
Lines.5b27d320-33aa-c0da-a28c-dce1a7cf18c2: However... perhaps getting to know them better wouldn't be harmful. They remind me of my old crew.
Lines.dd436b43-b8d8-aada-a3e9-3d94638b06d4: *Your shared dream of a network of authority that spans the Sword Coast.*
Lines.32797659-27df-5ed9-e058-9affebab384b: *Every contact established, and every deal struck.*
Lines.b30221fb-6ada-336d-d921-5af70820f769: It took far too long to recover from the loss of companionship my transformation forced upon me. I doubt I could persevere again if the need arose.
Lines.59963086-a90b-6a06-d945-c7dfb9a62503: It is... I meant that metaphorically. We will only need to control key members.
Lines.3434dd19-ee82-8c38-5f36-022e87d94a00: Our alliance with the Zhentarim puts us on the opposite side of Minsc... I expect the Guild to use him against us. We must be ready for that.
Lines.34921877-7e06-979d-5f25-7351bf31fca1: Perhaps, but it would be extremely risky. We could not withstand the full might of those citadels if we turned them against us.
Lines.d9186527-1477-156b-d8e0-21a40bf0d0ab: Ch'Chitl would be the likeliest candidate, though. That colony is governed by an Elder Concord like ours. It is unclear how firm its mental grip on its people is.
Lines.3c4b3b95-b3a2-2111-b3c1-049b60f4cb57: In all honesty... it will be decades, if not centuries, before our ideas take root in greater illithid culture. But we have planted a seed.
Lines.35977bc6-d165-354d-3d34-24c009fc1b44: Illithid technology is worth far more than an alliance with an inferior organization.
Lines.361bcdf8-43fe-e257-cda9-45891feafb2d: When that time comes... I would like a bite.
Lines.b5490fa7-650c-98ac-48ec-51ea9fc460d5: I posit that the benefits of such a trip will outweigh the negatives. It might be difficult... but I will have you. That's all I need.
Lines.36c89e7a-dc40-fd9a-22cd-9700175adcf3: So... what do you say? Would you like to go?
Lines.36ed18e6-a9b7-4655-a65f-90ddb167c666: An intriguing choice. Perhaps we could first visit Toril's mirror, Abeir? It would be familiar, but different.
Lines.386fe21d-9f6a-875b-a699-7a2f10541cb1: I agree. Though if it does not see reason... I will make it.
Lines.4116fb69-5ead-57e3-4ba6-48dfd7cfd404: I would like to revisit the locations of my old adventures. The ones from before my transformation.
Lines.982f3787-43e5-216d-5cf7-ce863332a907: Anchorome... and Yal Tengri's Great Spire of the Ice Sea. I would like to see if they have changed as much as I have.
Lines.42e6e5b0-70bc-4e19-0bc7-e52992d4bb90: No. The Far Realms do not treat humanoids kindly - they could warp your body and mind beyond recognition.
Lines.5c9c4b66-4cbe-abe1-a45b-1b60e04bf374: I will not risk losing you to madness.
Lines.bf5bbb10-34ab-9bee-a0d8-18e401896999: I believe two of the illithids that survived the Netherbrain's assault are excellent candidates for such a role: Kuuexiz and Araelya Delaren.
Lines.6d1dff33-fd40-ca03-0aee-cd76235cd81e: They have proven themselves capable with their leadership of the sanctuary. It is time for them to move on to greater purposes and allow others to rise.
Lines.43065c00-5356-1e50-ea73-b500251cffb2: If they accept, I will instruct them in their duties to the Knights and assign them to us.
Lines.f4d3833e-0b6a-7a4a-8834-b9a2e2fb550a: *The Emperor stunning imps with a mind blast, leaving their heads vulnerable to your charging axe.*
Lines.eacd5e8f-d519-175e-4169-9cfb166794bc: *Every cambion skull cracked by the Emperor's maw, and every lemure crushed under your feet.*
Lines.45c3f65f-4ad5-b043-f80f-858221a9e48e: *Navigating caves, dodging fireballs, choking on smoke.*
Lines.6f75386f-7fe0-5bd5-ce76-89db3bc23cf7: *The brief rests between fights, where the only beings in Avernus are you and the Emperor.*
Lines.59c86930-ccad-01f8-eea1-727457eb5d74: They must believe in our authority. I don't expect it to, but if this requires a suggestion... I will be tempted to give it.
Lines.48a002f0-c202-e862-7763-92171c42f41f: *Your coordinated strikes - aligned in the perfection only linked minds can achieve.*
Lines.5883faf1-e99e-4c36-a8ea-2261362ae4b7: *Every priceless treasure, but also every worthless souvenir. The gaudiest ruins, the simplest caves.*
Lines.e6c43778-43c8-2962-84e6-b6dc1cb4d134: *Lying together after a delve, sitting on a valley overlook, dreaming of the wildest destinations in the Realms.*
Lines.80b311f9-cffb-f25c-3ae2-d79d66b2585d: *The shared anticipation of the next great adventure.*
Lines.7a948180-e558-e0b9-4046-1f62df857de1: I can recall few events I have anticipated more than our attack on the forge. The hope that we might be able to fix your heart...
Lines.c0d87a1f-c65c-0b8b-2736-6c727fd629e3: Like any people, ours is not a monolith. The dominant narratives about our kind are narrow in their portrayal of us.
Lines.4aaefbab-f707-e663-1de4-22b86a01b7bd: I believe illithid culture is at fault for our ostracization from the surface. Domination of this world will never succeed, and thus coexistence is the only reasonable path forward.
Lines.b3d5602d-d9a0-fef5-ea53-2d6c4a303b6a: It is illogical to believe that no other illithids understand this - though the elder brains likely prevent them from realizing they want a different life.
Lines.df6c336d-453c-27b0-8eed-03dda7c40f5f: Many, of course, enjoy traditional illithid life. It is up to us to surmise who does.
Lines.4b93ebd5-77d0-a18f-217e-dddb39d093a8: Being here has caused me to reflect on all I have gained, but also on all I have lost.
Lines.4db34c39-a289-8f24-d583-36c664a01359: Jaheira has earned a rest. She has had a hand in more events of consequence than most.
Lines.4ed9f00c-9282-265d-daae-5c56bff1d812: I hope what the tressym said about your form does not bother you. She is ignorant, like all who believe such things.
Lines.4eee6c2f-0a4e-5324-6450-66cc0a2b9ee7: It is worth asking her. Allies are always useful.
Lines.57d301fb-2385-a04f-e34b-d8e14e359cc5: I have no interest in forcing them to. Unwilling agents are harmful to our operation.
Lines.e4e11703-f55c-2ad2-9e44-eb07d1d69d50: I will ensure they understand their prospective duties and allow them time to think on them.
Lines.58c21d2d-9aed-21ed-3de5-57cbbf8a7dc0: I hope the cities will see it as a relief of overcrowded prisons and not a reason to exterminate us... all the same, it is worth the attempt.
Lines.59615710-0d4f-1160-9b69-465675c8c8bc: Your concern for our pet is touching. We can support another.
